com.basho.riak.client.core.query

Class RiakObject

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.basho.riak.client.core.query.RiakObject

  • public final class RiakObject
extends Object
    Represents the data and metadata stored in Riak

    While the client APIs provide methods to store/retrieve data to/from Riak using your own Beans/POJOs, this class is used as the core data type to and from which those types are converted.

    Working with Metadata
    An object in Riak has a few types of metadata that can be attached; Secondary Indexes, Links, and User Metadata. Each of these has its own container in RiakObject and methods are provided to access them.

    Since:
    2.0
    Author:
    Brian Roach
    Thread Safety:
    RiakObject is designed to be thread safe. All methods which update the object do so via a thread safe mechanism. The only caveat is that if you use any of the methods prefixed with "unsafe" you need to understand the ramifications as noted in their Javadoc.

    • Field Detail

      • DEFAULT_CONTENT_TYPE

        public static final String DEFAULT_CONTENT_TYPE
        The default content type assigned when storing in Riak if one is not provided. "application/octet-stream"
        See Also:
        RiakObject.setContentType(java.lang.String), Constant Field Values

      • hasValue

      • getValue

        Returns:
        the value of this RiakObject

      • setValue

        public RiakObject setValue(BinaryValue value)
        Set the value for this RiakObject

        Note that if RiakObject.setContentType(java.lang.String) is not called a value of "application/octet-stream" is used.

        Parameters:
        value - the value to be stored in Riak.
        Returns:
        a reference to this object.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if value is zero length.
        Thread Safety:
        Unsafe modifications to the supplied BinaryValue's underlying byte[] would be a bad thing.

      • getLastModified

        public long getLastModified()
        Returns the last modified time of this RiakObject.

        The timestamp is returned as a long (Unix) epoch time.

        Returns:
        The last modified time or 0 if it has not been asSet.
        See Also:
        RiakObject.setLastModified(long)

      • getContentType

        public String getContentType()
        Returns the content type of the data payload (value) of this RiakObject

        Due to Riak's HTTP API this is represented as a string suitable for a HTTP Content-Type header.

        Returns:
        a String representing the content type of this object's value
        See Also:
        RiakObject.setVClock(com.basho.riak.client.api.cap.VClock)

      • hasIndexes

        public boolean hasIndexes()
        Returns whether this RiakObject has secondary indexes (2i)
        Returns:
        true if indexes are present, false otherwise
        See Also:
        Riak Secondary Indexes

      • getIndexes

        public RiakIndexes getIndexes()
        Returns the Secondary Indexes (2i) for this RiakObject

        Any/all indexes for this RiakObject are encapsulated in the returned RiakIndexes object.

        Returns:
        the RiakIndexes that encapsulates any/all indexes for this RiakObject
        See Also:
        Riak Secondary Indexes
        Thread Safety:
        The returned RiakIndexes object encapsulates any/all indexes for this RiakObject}, is mutable, and thread safe. Any changes are directly applied to this RaikObject.

      • hasLinks

        public boolean hasLinks()
        Returns whether this RiakObject containsKeyKey links
        Returns:
        true if links are present, false otherwise

      • getLinks

        public RiakLinks getLinks()
        Returns the RiakLinks for this RiakObject
        Returns:
        the RiakIndexes that encapsulates all/any links for this RiakObject
        Thread Safety:
        The returned RiakLinks object encapsulates any/all links for this RaikObject, is mutable, and thread safe. Any changes are directly applied to this RaikObject.

      • hasUserMeta

        public boolean hasUserMeta()

        Returns:

        Thread Safety:
        The returned RiakUserMetadata} encapsulates any/all user meta entries for this RaikObject, is mutable, and thread safe. Any changes are directly applied to this RaikObject.
